page.title: 03AREA HISTORY TO WORLD WAR I.
page.content: The greatest single influence on the area has been the opening of the {Altrincham to Knutsford Railway}line in 1862. Many residents at the time opposed the opening of a station in Hale. The immediate impact was to stimulate housing development to accomodate all classes of resident esp. workers' cottages to the North of the Survey area. This then placed pressure on church and school provision. It was only after l908 that the Stamford Trustees agreed to permit their houses on Ashley Road to be converted into shops. A few of the older residents interviewed used to own shops: of note were Southern's bakers <est.l820> and Schofield's drapers <est.l880>. A famous landmark was{Peel Causeway,}cottages forming part of the Railway Station and later {Siddeley's Brewery}before demolition.
